alert.note: Alert for Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 1:29PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ouray, northeastern San Miguel and southeastern Montrose Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 129 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Loghill Village, or 21 miles south of Montrose, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Ouray, northeastern San Miguel and southeastern Montrose Counties. This includes Colorado 62 between mile markers 6 and 11, and between mile markers 14 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide
